'BgriAr —' a Mr. Shone. Wo. 84. 19th October,1944. D: 12.42 p.m. GMT 19th October,1944. R: 3.10 p.m. BST 19th October,1944. 0.0. Repeated to FOREIGN OFFICE No. 2079. 5 5 5 Sir Ronald Cross United Kingdom High Commissioner for Australia has been delayed and is now due to leave here on Saturday morning October 21st by regular B.O.^oC. Ensign arriving at Karachi afternoon October 22nd and Delhi same evening. He is travelling alone. Please inform SACSEA most immediately reference his telegram to Middle East SAC 8,504 October 13th. 2. Sir Ronald Cross has received message from Mr. Casey in viting him to Darjeeling, Sir R. Cross regrets that he will not have time to make this visit but will be glad to avail himself of accommodation at Calcutta which Mr. Casey informed him was being provided by the army. Please inform Mr. Casey and the military authorities concerned.

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 4; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: This file contains a pair of telegrams between HM Ambassador, Cairo, and the Government of India regarding travel information for Sir Ronald Cross's (United Kingdom High Commissioner for Australia) travel throughout India and Pakistan.
